Finally, after 2 unsuccessful tries to get Macs to work, this one actually does work!
Sad, that there are no tutorials about getting this to work on VirtualBox - what would be the differences anyway?

Anyway, audio can be fixed easily and for Adobe Flash issue, it can be solved easily too.

This works on my PC: XP Pro SP3 x86, Intel Core i7 2600K, 4GB DDR3, 2GB AMD HD 6950 DVI.

The only problem is to find some programs to put on Mac. Bricksmith sure was crap.

This works for me on Linux/AMD64/VirtualBox-4.1.2:

Create VM, select type "Mac OS X Server"
Disable EFI by unchecking Settings -> System -> Enable EFI
Add boot CD in "Storage -> CD/DVD Drive -> Choose a virtual CD/DVD disk file". Select "EmpireEFI4AMD.iso" (this is in the directory "Boot .iso's [Not Required, But Just In Case]/" from this torrent).

Security Essentials detected programs that may compromise your privacy or damage your computer. You can still access the files that these programs use without removing them (not recommended). To access these files, select the Allow action and click Apply actions. If this option is not available, log on as administrator or ask the security administrator for help.

The patch files are not any kind of virus. They're picked up as one because of what they need to do to patch certain files.

If you need help with certain issues, you need to post give us a little more information than "this isn't working." Computer specs and detailed information like what you were doing and what messages you are receiving.
